Exhaustion

Cumulative condition representing extreme fatigue

Exhaustion Levels

Exhaustion is measured in six levels. Each time you receive Exhaustion, you gain 1 level. You die if your Exhaustion level reaches 6.

Effects by Level

LevelEffect
1D20 Tests -2
2D20 Tests -4, Speed -5 ft
3D20 Tests -6, Speed -10 ft
4D20 Tests -8, Speed -15 ft
5D20 Tests -10, Speed -20 ft
6Death

Gaining Exhaustion

  • Extreme environmental conditions
  • Starvation or dehydration
  • Spell effects (e.g., Sickening Radiance)
  • Class features (e.g., Barbarian's Frenzy)

Removing Exhaustion

Finishing a Long Rest removes 1 Exhaustion level. When your Exhaustion level reaches 0, the condition ends.
